intro: Mukia leiosperma, commonly known as the smooth-fruited mukia, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are smooth and glossy. It produces clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. The fruit is a small, round drupe that turns red when mature, attracting various bird species.
